primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration and rectification of a failed human subject (Peter/Hearer) by the gaze and resurrection of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord turned and looked at Peter
He has taken all the discounting and discrediting and despising unto himself
reconstituted to be in fellowship with our Lord forever
The Judge of all the universe... fixes his eyes
the light of the justice and the grace of God
for Peter’s redemption, and for ours
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly placed in the position of the Receiver/Beneficiary of the action.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Intercession of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit intercedes for us with sighs too deep for words
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the internal Helper providing competence.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that sustains faith when human power fails.

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan / The 'Dark Side' of the Self / Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely a bad habit but a cosmic demand (Satan) and an ontological failure (total fraud) that requires divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the restored believer to strengthen others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Restored Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (strengthening brothers) is strictly conditional on the completion of the primary program (Jesus turning/looking/restoring).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Jesus → Redemption of the Failed Human

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord found him with that look
Christ the Lord is interceding for you
He has paid the price and won the victory
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We throw out the incriminating documents
Peter went out and wept bitterly

voorbeelden: Even if I must die with you
Peter wanted the church to remember
Peter knew himself for the first time to be a total fraud
How can we stand...? The answer is, we can’t
How can our faith fail when we have the Holy Trinity on our side?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total lack of human 'pouvoir' (ability) and the gift of divine 'pouvoir' through intercession and resurrection.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Impunity' of family secrets to the 'Betrayal' of Peter, into the 'Wrath' of the look, finally resolved in the 'Rectification' of Easter.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'discounting and discrediting' (S2) onto Himself to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon explicitly critiques the removal of 'wrath' from modern lectionaries.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human subject as fundamentally incompetent and makes Christ the sole agent of restoration.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus uncovers Peter’s folly... Jesus was interceding

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is used as an example of failure and reception, not as a model to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: God saves like He saved Peter.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-justification and pretense.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration; the hearer is the object of God's action.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly ordered: human failure leads to divine intervention, which results in a new capacity for service.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has taken all the discounting and discrediting and despising unto himself.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'sighs' and the faith that the human cannot maintain.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is seen as a total unmasking of the self as a 'fraud'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is theologically appropriate for Eastertide.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure, successfully avoiding the trap of turning Peter into a moral example.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'family secrets' hook, semiotics reveals that this hook serves to establish the 'Opponent' of pretense.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of the Greek to show how the functional roles of Jesus and Peter interact to create a 'Grammar of Grace'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'look' of Jesus is the pivotal actantial event that transfers the Subject role from Peter's ego to Christ's intercession.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Even Peter' motif to ensure the hearer cannot escape the Receiver actant role.
